content:
OperationInfo Class

In this Article

Represents the information for a contract operation defined in a workflow service.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated.  Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")]
public sealed class OperationInfo : System.Workflow.Activities.OperationInfoBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DependencyObject
  • System.Workflow.Activities.OperationInfoBase
  • OperationInfo

Inherited Members

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

The OperationInfo class is used to define service contract information for a ReceiveActivity activity.

Note

The OperationInfo class can be used only with a workflow-first service. For more information about workflow-first services, see Workflow Service Authoring Styles.

Constructors summary

OperationInfo()

Initializes a new instance of the OperationInfo class.

Properties summary

ContractName

Gets or sets the full name of the contract that defines this operation.
HasProtectionLevel

Gets information on whether or not the operation has a defined ProtectionLevel.
IsOneWay

Gets or sets information on the operation to specify that communication between the service and a client is one-way.
Parameters

Gets a collection of OperationParameterInfo objects that represents the parameter definitions used by the operation.
ProtectionLevel

Gets or sets the ProtectionLevel of an operation.

Methods summary

Clone()

Creates a copy of the object.
Equals(Object)

Determines whether two object instances are equal.
GetContractFullName(IServiceProvider)
GetContractType(IServiceProvider)
GetHashCode()

Returns a hash code for the current OperationInfo.
GetIsOneWay(IServiceProvider)
GetMethodInfo(IServiceProvider)
GetParameters(IServiceProvider)
ToString()

Provides a string that represents this instance.

Constructors

  • OperationInfo()

    Initializes a new instance of the OperationInfo class.

    public OperationInfo ();

    Remarks

    When activities are deserialized from Xoml, the constructors for the associated properties are called automatically.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to create a new instance of the OperationInfo class. 

    OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();

    Dim info As New OperationInfo()

Properties

  • ContractName

    Gets or sets the full name of the contract that defines this operation.

    public string ContractName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A string that represents the full name of the contract that defines the operation.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to access the ContractName property. 

    OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();
info.ContractName = "Contract1";

    Dim info As New OperationInfo()
info.ContractName = "Contract1"
  • HasProtectionLevel

    Gets information on whether or not the operation has a defined ProtectionLevel.

    public bool HasProtectionLevel { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      A Boolean value indicating whether or not the operation has a ProtectionLevel associated with it.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to access the HasProtectionLevel property. 

    OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();
bool hasProtectionLevel = info.HasProtectionLevel;

    Dim info As New OperationInfo()
         Dim hasProtectionLevel = info.HasProtectionLevel
  • IsOneWay

    Gets or sets information on the operation to specify that communication between the service and a client is one-way.

    public bool IsOneWay { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the operation supports one-way communication; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default value is false.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to access the IsOneWay property. 

    OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();
bool isOneWay = info.IsOneWay;

    Dim info As New OperationInfo()
         Dim isOneWay = info.IsOneWay
  • Parameters

    Gets a collection of OperationParameterInfo objects that represents the parameter definitions used by the operation.

    public System.Workflow.Activities.OperationParameterInfoCollection Parameters { get; }

    Property Value

    • OperationParameterInfoCollection

      A collection of OperationParameterInfo objects that represents the parameter definitions used by the operation when called by a client.

    Remarks

    The Parameters collection will contain one element for each parameter in the method signature of the operation, plus one element for the return value of the operation.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to access the Parameters property. 

    ReceiveActivity receive = new ReceiveActivity();
OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();
info.Name = "Echo";
OperationParameterInfo parameterInfo = new OperationParameterInfo();
parameterInfo.Attributes = ((System.Reflection.ParameterAttributes)((System.Reflection.ParameterAttributes.Out | System.Reflection.ParameterAttributes.Retval)));
parameterInfo.Name = "(ReturnValue)";
parameterInfo.ParameterType = typeof(string);
parameterInfo.Position = -1;
info.Parameters.Add(parameterInfo);
receive.ServiceOperationInfo = info;

    Dim receive As New ReceiveActivity()
Dim info As New OperationInfo()
info.Name = "Echo"
Dim parameterInfo As New OperationParameterInfo()
         parameterInfo.Attributes = (CType((System.Reflection.ParameterAttributes.Out Or System.Reflection.ParameterAttributes.Retval),  _
                                     System.Reflection.ParameterAttributes))
parameterInfo.Name = "(ReturnValue)"
parameterInfo.ParameterType = GetType(String)
parameterInfo.Position = -1
info.Parameters.Add(parameterInfo)
receive.ServiceOperationInfo = info
  • ProtectionLevel

    Gets or sets the ProtectionLevel of an operation.

    public Nullable<System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel> ProtectionLevel { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Nullable<ProtectionLevel>

      A ProtectionLevel object used by the operation.

    Remarks

    The default value is null, which means that the protection level is not set.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to access the ProtectionLevel property. 

    OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();
info.ProtectionLevel = System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel.EncryptAndSign;

    Dim info As New OperationInfo()
info.ProtectionLevel = System.Net.Security.ProtectionLevel.EncryptAndSign

Methods

  • Clone()

    Creates a copy of the object.

    public override System.Workflow.Activities.OperationInfoBase Clone ();

    Returns

    • System.Workflow.Activities.OperationInfoBase

      The copy of the OperationInfo object.

    Remarks

    This method creates a deep copy of the OperationInfo object, with the same ContractName, IsOneWay, Parameters, and ProtectionLevel values.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the Clone method. 

    OperationInfo info1 = new OperationInfo();
OperationInfo info2 = (OperationInfo)info1.Clone();

    Dim info1 As New OperationInfo()
         Dim info2 As OperationInfo = CType(info1.Clone(), OperationInfo)
  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether two object instances are equal.

    public override bool Equals (object obj);

    Parameters

    • obj
      Object

      The object to compare with the current OperationInfo.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true to indicate that the current OperationInfo and obj are equal; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This operation compares the values of the ContractName, IsOneWay, Parameters, and ProtectionLevel values.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the Equals method. 

    OperationInfo info1 = new OperationInfo();
info1.Name = "ProcessData";
OperationInfo info2 = new OperationInfo();
info2.Name = "ProcessData";
return info1.Equals(info2);

    Dim info1 As New OperationInfo()
info1.Name = "ProcessData"
Dim info2 As New OperationInfo()
info2.Name = "ProcessData"
Return info1.Equals(info2)
  • GetContractFullName(IServiceProvider)
    protected override string GetContractFullName (IServiceProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • provider
      IServiceProvider

      To be added.

    Returns

    • String

      To be added.

  • GetContractType(IServiceProvider)
    protected override Type GetContractType (IServiceProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • provider
      IServiceProvider

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Type

      To be added.

  • GetHashCode()

    Returns a hash code for the current OperationInfo.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      A hash code for this instance.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the GetHashCode method. 

    OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();
info.Name = "ProcessData";
int code = info.GetHashCode();

    Dim info As New OperationInfo()
info.Name = "ProcessData"
         Dim code = info.GetHashCode()
  • GetIsOneWay(IServiceProvider)
    protected override bool GetIsOneWay (IServiceProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • provider
      IServiceProvider

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      To be added.

  • GetMethodInfo(IServiceProvider)
    protected override System.Reflection.MethodInfo GetMethodInfo (IServiceProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • provider
      IServiceProvider

      To be added.

    Returns

    • MethodInfo

      To be added.

  • GetParameters(IServiceProvider)
    protected override System.Workflow.Activities.OperationParameterInfoCollection GetParameters (IServiceProvider provider);

    Parameters

    • provider
      IServiceProvider

      To be added.

    Returns

    • OperationParameterInfoCollection

      To be added.

  • ToString()

    Provides a string that represents this instance.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      A string that represents this instance.

    Remarks

    This method returns the ContractName value if extant; otherwise, it returns the Name value.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the ToString method. 

    OperationInfo info = new OperationInfo();
String infoString = info.ToString();

    Dim info As New OperationInfo()
         Dim infoString = info.ToString()
